article_text:
President Obama appears to be somewhat unique in use of the words "sorry" or "apologize," terms that rarely emanate from presidential lips. (Photo: Charles Dharapak, AP)

President Obama said on Nov. 14 that Americans can keep canceled health insurance policies for a year. The statement comes after he apologized to individuals that received cancellation notices.

The president also noted that the administration "fumbled" the rollout of the Healthcare.gov website. In 5 GIFs we'll give you a condensed version of the Affordable Care Act story.

Read or Share this story: http://usat.ly/1ct984t

article_metadata.description: President Obama said today that Americans can keep canceled health insurance policies for a year.
